create_trainwrecked.ponder.assembly_trai: Until now, only a train control was needed to assemble a train.
Now, an engine is required for assembly.
Not only the engine, but also a portable fluid interface for transferring fuel is required.
Among the carriages with tanks, at least one carriage requires a portable fluid interface.
If the appropriate fuel for the engine is stored in the train's fluid tank...
The train automatically consumes the fuel from the tank while operating.
The number of blocks that can be glued to the train is limited by the engine's specifications and quantity.
As the number of blocks loaded on the train increases, the train's acceleration and turning top speed decrease.
create_trainwrecked.ponder.diesel_engine: Diesel engine is an advanced form of engine.
When installed on a train with a diesel-filled tank...
The train automatically consumes the diesel in the tank.
The train automatically consumes the diesel in the tank.
Diesel engines do not require a heat source!
Diesel engines perform better than steam engines in terms of efficiency.
create_trainwrecked.ponder.overheat.head: Overheat
create_trainwrecked.ponder.overheat.text: If the engine is left running for a long time...
The engine overheats and stops working.
To prevent this, ice can be used.
Not only ice, but all ice-related items can be used.
The degree to which the engine cools varies depending on the coldness of the item.
Ice inside the train's chest or barrel is automatically consumed by the train.
Ice in the item vault is not consumed.
If the engine is left alone for a sufficient amount of time while overheated...
The engine cools down, allowing it to operate again.
Steam engine is the most basic form of engine.
Fuel in the item vault is not consumed.
When installed on a train with a water-filled tank...
The train automatically consumes the water in the tank.
When assembling the train, a heat source is required to heat the water in the fluid tank.
The heat source must be placed directly below the fluid tank.
Depending on the number and heat level of the heat sources, water consumption, maximum speed limit, and acceleration vary.
The heat level of a heat source varies depending on its type.
Some heat sources consume fuel in the form of items.
Fuel inside the train's boxes or containers is automatically consumed by the heat source.
create_trainwrecked.ponder.tag.assemblin: Didn't you find the original train assembly conditions boring? Here's a new challenge for all of you!
create_trainwrecked.train_assembly.no_fl: Requires least one carriage have both %1$s and %2$s.
create_trainwrecked.train_assembly.no_he: Heat Source Not Found, to boil water requires at least one heat source, Only heat sources below the fluid tanks are detected.
create_trainwrecked.train_assembly.too_m: Too Many Contraption Blocks, With the current engines, up to %s can be placed, Current blocks: %s
Too Many Carriages, With the current engines, up to %s can be configured, Current carriages: %s
create_trainwrecked.train_google.overhea: It appears that this train's engine is overheated.
Use ice or wait %ss to cool down the engine.
item.create_trainwrecked.jerrycan.toolti: _Drain fluid_ from clicked block. _Sneak_ while interacting to _fill fluid_ to block.
_Drain fluid_ from clicked carriage's fluid tanks. _Sneak_ while interacting to _fill fluid_ fluid tanks.
When used on Fluid Interface in Train Carraige
Portable fluid carriage for your fuel exhaustion emergency.
tooltip.create_trainwrecked.item_full: Can't drain fluid, jerrycan can't accept fluid
tooltip.create_trainwrecked.storage_full: Can't fill fluid, fluid storage can't accept fluid
